kulami.game

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • kulami.game.Game
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GameObservable

    public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
implements GameObservable
    The class Game represents the current state of a Kulami game.

    To construct a Game, a Player, a game level, a DisplayFlags object, and a Board have to be provided.

    Objects can track the state of a Game by registering as a GameObserver.

    Author:
    gordon

      • Game

        public Game(Board board,
    Player player,
    int level,
    DisplayFlags displayFlags)
        Constructs a new Game using an existing Board object.
        Parameters:
        board - the game board
        player - the local player
        level - game level (0, 1, or 2)
        displayFlags - DisplayFlags object reference to be passed on

      • Game

        public Game(java.lang.String boardCode,
    Player player,
    int level,
    DisplayFlags displayFlags)
     throws IllegalBoardCode
        Constructs a new Game using a 200-character board code.

        The board code consists of 100 pairs of letters identifying panels and numbers identifying owners.

        Parameters:
        boardCode - a 200-character board code
        player - the local player
        level - game level (0, 1, or 2)
        displayFlags - DisplayFlags object reference to be passed on
        Throws:
        IllegalBoardCode

      • pushMap

        public void pushMap()
        Force the game to notify GameObservers of a changed board.

        This method is useful when first initializing a Game.
